plt.show()
source.c75d70e8:
# Direct comparing

data_disney_clean['Platform']= np.zeros(1450)
data_net_clean['Platform'] = np.ones(8807)

frames = [data_disney_clean,data_net_clean]
net_dis = pd.concat(frames)
net_dis.head(n=-10)

plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
sns.countplot(x='type',data=net_dis,hue='Platform',palette='cool')
plt.legend(title='Platform', loc='upper right', labels=['Disney+', 'Netflix'])
plt.title('Direct comparing', pad = 15, fontsize = 18)
plt.xlabel('x', color='w')
plt.ylabel('x', color='w')
plt.show()

# Extrat from: https://www.kaggle.com/rahulyadav0710/netflix-disney, tks!
source.e04e7596:
# About Netflix

data_net_clean_NaN = data_netflix.drop(['show_id','cast','description','listed_in'], axis = 1).dropna()

series_net = data_net_clean_NaN[data_net_clean_NaN['duration'].str.contains('Season')]
filmes_net = data_net_clean_NaN[data_net_clean_NaN['duration'].str.contains('min')]

series_net_duration = []
filmes_net_duration = []

# Tv shows
for i in series_net['duration'].values:
    x = i.split()
    for ii in x[0]:
        xx = int(ii)
        math = ((xx*10)*45)/60
        series_net_duration.append(math)
        
# Movies
for i in filmes_net['duration'].values:
    x = i.split()
    for ii in x[:1]:
        xx = int(ii)/60
        filmes_net_duration.append(xx)

###########################################################################################################


# About Disney

data_disney_clean_NaN = data_disney.drop(['show_id','cast','description','listed_in'], axis = 1).dropna()

series_disney = data_disney_clean_NaN[data_disney_clean_NaN['duration'].str.contains('Season')]
filmes_disney = data_disney_clean_NaN[data_disney_clean_NaN['duration'].str.contains('min')]

series_disney_duration = []
filmes_disney_duration = []

# Tv shows
for i in series_disney['duration'].values:
    x = i.split()
    for ii in x[0]:
        xx = int(ii)
        math = ((xx*10)*45)/60
        series_disney_duration.append(math)
        
# Movies
for i in filmes_disney['duration'].values:
    x = i.split()
    for ii in x[:1]:
        xx = int(ii)/60
        filmes_disney_duration.append(xx)


###############################################################################################################

# Results of this

results_net = round(sum(series_net_duration)+sum(filmes_net_duration), 2)
results_disney = round(sum(series_disney_duration)+sum(filmes_disney_duration), 2)
source.0d85b469:
frame1 = pd.DataFrame(data = (results_disney, results_net), index=('Disney+', 'Netflix'))
frame1.plot.barh(figsize =(12,6))
plt.title('how much time you will spend', pad =15, fontsize = 18)
plt.legend(fontsize = 0)
plt.xlabel('Hours', fontsize=14)
plt.show()
source.eaee1227:
# about release_year, what is the age of movies and tv shows?

plt.subplot(2,1,1)
ano = data_net_clean['release_year'].value_counts()[:15].plot.bar(figsize=(16,8))
plt.xticks(rotation = 0)
plt.title('Most popular age of movies and tv show on Netflix', pad = 15, fontsize = 18)
plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize = 14)
plt.ylabel('Amount',fontsize = 14)
plt.show()

plt.subplot(2,1,2)
ano = data_disney_clean['release_year'].value_counts()[:15].plot.bar(figsize=(16,8))
plt.xticks(rotation = 0)
plt.title('Most popular age of movies and tv show on Disney+', pad = 15, fontsize = 18)
plt.xlabel('Year', fontsize = 14)
plt.ylabel('Amount',fontsize = 14)
plt.show()

source.ab3b873b:
# Compare Netflix and Disney+

Task: Comparative analysis can be performed for different platforms, in order to get the strategies, content, and other analysis

Netflix and Disney plus are a global show for streaming movies and television series

Streaming is the name given to the technology that is capable of transmitting data over the internet without the need to download the content onto a device. The most frequently transmitted files involve image and audio, being short videos, long videos and music

![image.png](attachment:e85b7bb6-bbf9-4ed1-9dad-56ae3d9954ce.png) [Link of this image](https://podecomparar.com.br/telecom/comparativas/plataformas/qual-melhor-streaming-netflix-disney-plus)

source.8f519f9b:
How much time do you spend to watch all the movies and TV shows that exist on each platform?

There is a funny fact about this plataforms. We know that these platforms are intended to entertain. However, it is also known that we cannot stay all day watching. Despite being a funny fact, there is a little seriousness, because how much time in our lives will we spend watching movies and TV shows that will add almost nothing, or nothing, to our professional life, family life, personal life, social life, etc?

So... how much time we will spend if we pretend watch all movies and tvshows? (obviously that it's an extreme case)

First of all, i will set each movie and tvshows by the HOURS. We know that the most episodes on tv shows have a average of 45 min. Another thing that we need to now is the amount of ep have in one sesson... I'm going to guess that, the minimum, is 10 ep for the season per tvshows...

Here i need to make a little ajust because some TV Shows and movies was NaN or Null. Because of this i drop some itens...
